content: Russian opera is a rich and varied tradition that has produced many famous and influential works. Some of the most well-known Russian operas include Tchaikovsky's "Eugene Onegin," "The Queen of Spades," and "The Sleeping Beauty," Rimsky-Korsakov's "The Snow Maiden" and "The Golden Cockerel," and Mussorgsky's "Boris Godunov" and "Khovanshchina." These operas often draw on Russian folklore, history, and literature for their stories and themes, and they often feature powerful and dramatic music that showcases the unique characteristics of the Russian vocal tradition.
